body.section: Hierarchy ScriptDue is a kind of DrugUseEvaluation

section.title: Description
section.p: This class represents two properties that the DUE composite in the NCPDP SCRIPT standard has that the NCPDP Telecommunication standard does not. In practice, this class' two properties, along with the one property that the Telecommunication standard uniquely contains would likely be moved to the DUE superclass, and we could have modeled it that way, but we've chosen to separate the subclasses in order to visually depict the differences between the two standards.

stentry.p: "Additional textual information regarding intervention and/or acknowledgment associated with a DUE conflict." - NCPDP Script (Field 7998, Data Dictionary 201104)

"Code identifying the significance or severity level of a clinical event as contained in the originating database.Code identifying the significance or severity level of a clinical event as contained in the originating database." - NCPDP Script (Field 7997, Data Dictionary 201104)
